params.name: serviceId
params.doc: ID of the service to retrieve.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of up to 100 services, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting.
`queryServices()` runs with these defaults, which you can override:
+ `paging.limit` is `100`.
+ `paging.offset` is `0`.
description:
>**Notes:**
> + Use UTC format when filtering with dates.
> + Only 1 use of each filter in the same query is supported. If a filter is defined more than once in a query, only the first occurrence is processed.

extra.description: Query services without any filters. The defaults are a `limit` of 100, and an `offset` of 0.
Using the `path` from the `url`, filter and retrieve the relevant service.

members.name: constraints
members.doc: Constraints for calculating the schedule's availability.

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the schedule stops being available for booking. No value indicates no end time.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc: Other schedules that impact the availability calculation. Relevant only when there are availability constraints.

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the schedule starts to be available for booking.

description:
<!-- Needs updating when recurrence has been tested
Schedule's availability calculation is executed by the schedule's available intervals and this additional information.
Schedule's available intervals are recurring intervals (defined in the schedule) minus sessions that has no more spots for bookings (including time between_slots), or schedule's sessions with open spots for bookings.-->

members.name: sessionDurations
members.doc:
A list of duration options for sessions, in minutes.

The availability calculation generates slots for sessions with these durations, unless there is a conflict with existing sessions or other availability constraints exist.
Required for services of type `APPOINTMENT` to allow the customer to book a session of the service. Not relevant for other service types.


Min: 1 minute

members.name: timeBetweenSessions
members.doc:
The number of minutes between the end of a session and the start of the next.

Min: 0 minutes
Max: 720 minutes

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc: Specify how to split the schedule slots in intervals of minutes.

description: Availability policy applied to all site schedules.

members.name: defaultBehavior
members.doc: Entry pass for resources, e.g. a ticket for Bookings service or a ticket for Events.

members.name: discount
members.doc: Discount applied to paid resources

members.name: defaultBehavior
members.doc: Entry pass for resources, e.g. a ticket for Bookings service or a ticket for Events.

members.doc: Discount applied to paid resources

members.name: creditAmount
members.doc: Amount of credits that provided by this benefit

members.doc: additional details related to benefit; limited to 20 entries, 20 symbols for key and 20 symbols for value

members.doc: return value only in case it required in the ListRequest, true means that benefit's type could be updated

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether booking is allowed after the start of the schedule. When `true`,
customers can book after the start of the schedule.

Default: `false`

description:
The policy for whether a session can be booked after the start of the schedule.
This policy and `LimitLateBookingPolicy` cannot be enabled at the same time. So if this policy
is enabled, the `LimitLateBookingPolicy` policy must be disabled.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the policy was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: The ID to the policy for the booking.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the policy was updated.

members.name: bookAfterStartPolicy
members.doc: Policy on booking an entity after the start of the schedule.

members.name: cancellationPolicy
members.doc: Policy for canceling a booked entity.

members.name: customPolicyDescription
members.doc: Custom description for the policy. This policy is displayed to the participant.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether the policy is the default for the meta site.

members.name: limitEarlyBookingPolicy
members.doc: Policy for limiting early bookings.

members.name: limitLateBookingPolicy
members.doc: Policy for limiting late bookings.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the policy.

members.name: participantsPolicy
members.doc: Policy regarding the participants per booking.

members.name: reschedulePolicy
members.doc: Policy for rescheduling a booked entity.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the policy is updated. To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a policy.

members.name: waitlistPolicy
members.doc: Waitlist policy for the service.

description:
`BookingPolicy` is the main entity of `BookingPolicyService` and specifies a set of rules for booking a service
by visitors and members.

members.name: bookingPolicy
members.doc: The booking policy.

members.name: services
members.doc: The services associated with the booking policy.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Business location ID.

members.name: address
members.doc: Business location address. The address is derived from the business location and is read-only.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be 1 default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: name
members.doc: Business location name.

members.name: periods
members.doc: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

description: Business schedule. Regular and exceptional time periods when the business is open or the service is available.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Wix Calendar conference ID.

members.name: accountOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the account owner in the video conferencing service.

members.name: conferenceType
members.doc:
Conference type.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER"` API-generated online meeting.
- `"CUSTOM"` User-defined meeting.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: description
members.doc: Conference description.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conference provider ID.

members.name: localDateTime
members.doc: An object containing the local date and time for the business's time zone.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
The time zone. Optional. Derived from the schedule's time zone.
In case this field is associated with recurring session, this field is empty.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
UTC date-time in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Coordinated_Universal_Time_(UTC)) format. If a time zone offset is specified, the time is converted to UTC. For example, if you specify  `new Date('2021-01-06T16:00:00.000-07:00')`, the stored value will be `"2021-01-06T23:00:00.000Z"`.
Required if `localDateTime` is not specified.
If `localDateTime` is specified, `timestamp` is calculated as `localDateTime`, using the business's time zone.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether canceling a booking is allowed. When `true`, customers
can cancel the booking.

Default: `false`

members.name: latestCancellationInMinutes
members.doc:
Minimum number of minutes before the start of the booked session that the booking can be canceled.

Default: 1440 minutes (1 day)
Min: 1 minute

members.name: limitLatestCancellation
members.doc:
Whether there is a limit on the latest cancellation time. When `true`,
a time limit is enforced.

Default: `false`

description: The policy for canceling a booked session.

description: Categories are used to group multiple services together. A service must be associated with a category in order to be exposed in the Wix Bookings UI.

members.name: event
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'Created'`
- `'Deleted'`
- `'Updated'`

description: An event sent every time a category entity is changed.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Use these cursor to paginate between results. [Read more](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language#getting-started_api-query-language_cursor-paging).

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.doc: A custom address for the location.

members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message.

members.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
members.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with participants. Optional, default is false.

members.name: revision

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message.

members.doc: ID of the service to disconnect the pricing plans from.

members.name: moneyOffAmount
members.doc: Absolute amount discount

members.name: percentOffRate
members.doc: Fixed-rate percent off discount

members.doc: Absolute amount discount

members.name: percentOffRate

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: pricingPlansIds
members.doc: IDs of the pricing plans to connect to the service.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: ID of the service to add the pricing plans to.

members.name: pricingPlansIds
members.doc: IDs of the pricing plans connect to the service.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Data Extensions extended fields
Key: Namespace
Value: extended fields data in Struct format

members.name: calendarType
members.doc: The external calendar type (e.g. Google Calendar, iCal, etc).

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: deposit
members.doc:
The deposit price required to book the service.

Required when: `rateType` is `FIXED` and `paymentOptions.deposit` is `true`

members.name: price
members.doc:
The fixed price required to book the service.

Required when: `rateType` is `FIXED`

members.name: _id
members.doc:
ID of the form associated with the service.
Form information submitted when booking, including contact details, participants, and other form fields, set up for the service.

members.name: hidden
members.doc: Whether the service booking form should be hidden from the site.

members.name: repetition
members.doc: The frequency of the recurrence in weeks. i.e. when this value is 4, the interval occurs every 4 weeks. Optional. The default is 1. minimum: 1, maximum: 52.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: ID of the service to retrieve.

members.name: service
members.doc: The retrieved service.

members.name: daysOfWeek
members.doc: The day the interval accrue. Optional. The default is the day of the recurring interval's start time.

members.name: duration
members.doc: The duration of the interval in minutes. Required. Part of the session end time calculation. minimum: 1, maximum: 86400.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: The hour of the day the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval start time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 23.

members.name: minuteOfHour
members.doc: The minutes of hour the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval end time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 59.

members.name: _id
members.doc: The invalid pricing plan id.

members.name: message
members.doc: The reason for the pricing plan considered as invalid

members.name: isMain
members.doc: Whether the keyword is the main focus keyword.

members.name: term
members.doc: Keyword value.

members.name: earliestBookingInMinutes
members.doc:
Maximum number of minutes before the start of the session that a booking can be made. This value must be greater
than `latest_booking_in_minutes` in the `LimitLateBookingPolicy` policy.

Default: 10080 minutes (7 days)
Min: 1 minute

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether there is a limit on how early a customer
can book. When `false`, there is no limit on the earliest
booking time and customers can book in advance, as early as they like.

Default: `false`

description: The policy for limiting early bookings.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether there is a limit on how late a customer
can book. When `false`, there is no limit on the latest
booking time and customers can book up to the last minute.

Default: `false`

members.name: latestBookingInMinutes
members.doc:
Minimum number of minutes before the start of the session that a booking can be made.
For a schedule, this is relative to the start time of the next booked session, excluding past-booked sessions.
This value must be less than `earliest_booking_in_minutes` in the `LimitEarlyBookingPolicy` policy.

Default: 1440 minutes (1 day)
Min: 1 minute

description: The policy for limiting late bookings.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets this schedule's availability for the duration of the linked schedule's sessions.  Default is `"BUSY"`.
<!--ONLY:REST-->
If set to `"BUSY"`, this schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
If set to `"FREE"`, this schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"FREE"` This schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
- `"BUSY"` This schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: dayOfMonth
members.doc: Day of the month, from 1-31.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: Hour of the day in 24-hour format, from 0-23.

members.name: minutesOfHour
members.doc: Minute, from 0-59.

members.name: monthOfYear
members.doc: Month number, from 1-12.

members.name: year
members.doc: Year. 4-digit format.

members.name: business
members.doc: The service is offered at the referenced business location.

members.name: calculatedAddress
members.doc: The location address, based on the location `type`. If `type` is `CUSTOMER`, this address is empty.

members.name: custom
members.doc: The service is offered at a custom location.

members.name: type
members.doc:
The type of location:
- `CUSTOM`: The location is specific to this service, and is not derived from the business location.
- `BUSINESS`: A business location, as defined for the by the Business Info [Locations API](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-business-tools-v2/locations).
- `CUSTOMER`: Will be determined by the customer. For appointments only.

members.name: business
members.doc: The service is offered at the referenced business location.

members.name: custom
members.doc: The service is offered at a custom location.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: 2-letter country code in an [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Postal or zip code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

description: Address Geolocation

members.name: _id
members.doc: Location ID.

members.name: address
members.doc: Address.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Whether the location is archived. Archived locations can't be updated.
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location)
doesn't affect its `status`.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Business schedule. Array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. Limited to 100 time periods.

__Note:__ Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be one default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: description
members.doc: Location description.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address.

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number.

members.name: locationType
members.doc: Location type. **Note:** Currently not supported.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the location is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a location.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Location status. Defaults to `ACTIVE`.
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location)
doesn't affect the location's status. `INACTIVE` is currently not supported.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Timezone in `America/New_York` format.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

description: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: coverMedia
members.doc: Cover media associated with the service.

members.name: items
members.doc: Media items associated with the service.

members.name: mainMedia
members.doc: Primary media associated with the service.

members.name: image
members.doc: Details of the image associated with the service, such as URL and size.

members.name: image
members.doc: Details of the image associated with the service, such as URL and size.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: formattedValue
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string in local format (e.g., 1 000,30). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

description:
Money.
Default format to use. Sufficiently compliant with majority of standards: w3c, ISO 4217, ISO 20022, ISO 8583:2003.

members.name: newLocation
members.doc: The new location to move existing sessions currently set to a removed location, used when `action` is `MOVE_TO_LOCATION`.

members.name: allowMultipleRequests
members.doc: Multiple customers can request to book the same time slot. Relevant when `requireManualApproval` is `true`.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether this service can be booked online.
When set to `true`, customers can book the service online. Configuring the payment options is done via `service.payment` property.
When set to `false`, customers cannot book the service online, and the service can only be paid for in person.

members.name: requireManualApproval
members.doc: Booking the service requires approval by the business owner.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Participant ID. Currently represents the booking.id.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc:
Approval status for the participant.
<!-- Commented out untill updateParticipant is exposed Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant()` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.-->
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"PENDING"` Pending business approval.
- `"APPROVED"` Approved by the business.
- `"DECLINED"` Declined by the business.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: message
members.doc: Custom message to send to the participants about the changes to the booking.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to send the message about the changes to the customer. `false` by default

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the maximum number of participants applies. When `false`, there is
no maximum.

Default: `false`

members.name: maxParticipantsPerBooking
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants allowed.

Default: 1 participant
Min: 1 participant

description: The policy for the maximum number of participants per booking.

members.name: custom
members.doc:
The details for the custom price of the service.

Required when: `rateType` is `CUSTOM`

members.name: fixed
members.doc:
The details for the fixed price of the service.

Required when: `rateType` is `FIXED`

members.name: options
members.doc: The payment options a customer can use to pay for the service.

members.name: pricingPlansIds
members.doc: IDs of pricing plans that can be used as payment for the service.

members.name: rateType
members.doc:
The rate the customer is expected to pay for the service.
Can be:
- `FIXED`: The service has a fixed price.
- `CUSTOM`: The service has a custom price, expressed as a price description.
- `VARIED`: This service is offered with a set of different prices based on different terms.
- `NO_FEE`: This service is offered free of charge.

members.name: varied
members.doc:
The details for the varied pricing of the service.
Read more about [varied price options](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-about-getting-paid-online#offering-varied-price-options).

Required when: `rateType` is `VARIED`

members.name: deposit
members.doc:
This service requires a deposit to be made online in order to book it.
When `true`:
+ `rateType` must be `VARIED` or `FIXED`.
+ A `deposit` must be specified.

members.name: inPerson
members.doc: Customers can pay for the service in person.

members.name: online
members.doc:
Customers can pay for the service online.
When `true`:
+ `rateType` must be either `FIXED` or `VARIED`.
+ `fixed.price` or `varied.default_price` must be specified respectively. Read more about [getting paid online](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-about-getting-paid-online).

members.name: pricingPlan
members.doc: Customers can pay for the service using a pricing plan.

members.name: custom
members.doc:
The details for the custom price of the service.

Required when: `rateType` is `CUSTOM`

members.name: fixed
members.doc:
The details for the fixed price of the service.

Required when: `rateType` is `FIXED`

members.name: varied
members.doc:
The details for the varied pricing of the service.
Read more about [varied price options](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-about-getting-paid-online#offering-varied-price-options).

Required when: `rateType` is `VARIED`

members.name: description
members.doc:
The description to display.

Default: Empty
Max length: 1000 characters

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the description should be displayed. If `true`, the description is displayed.

Default: `false`

description: A description of the policy to display to participants.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: Amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

members.name: query
members.doc: WQL expression.

members.name: bookingPolicies
members.doc: The retrieved policies.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata, including offset and count.

members.name: query
members.doc: WQL expression.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata, including offset and count.

members.name: services
members.doc: The retrieved services.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[ {"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},
{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"} ]`

Read more about [sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/services-v2/filtering-and-sorting#wix-bookings_services-v2_filtering-and-sorting_sorting).

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc:
Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.
When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: priceText
members.doc:
Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.
When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: _id
members.doc: The recurring interval identifier.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc: Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability. Can be calculated from the schedule or overridden on the recurring interval.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the recurring interval. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: frequency
members.doc: The frequency of the interval. Optional. The default is frequency with the default repetition.

members.name: interval
members.doc: The interval rules. The day, hour and minutes the interval is recurring.

members.name: intervalType
members.doc:
The type of recurring interval.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"UNDEFINED"` The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
- `"EVENT"` A recurring interval of events.
- `"WORKING_HOURS"` A recurring interval for availability.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the recurring interval. Required.

members.name: newRecurringSessions
members.doc: New schedule's recurring session list.

members.name: oldRecurringSessions
members.doc: Old schedule's recurring session list.

members.name: action
members.doc: The action to perform on sessions currently set to a removed location.

members.name: moveToLocationOptions
members.doc: Options related to the action, such as a new location to move existing sessions to.

members.name: moveToLocationOptions
members.doc: Options related to the action, such as a new location to move existing sessions to.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether rescheduling a booking is allowed. When `true`, customers
can reschedule the booking.

Default: `false`

members.name: latestRescheduleInMinutes
members.doc:
Minimum number of minutes before the start of the booked session that the booking can be rescheduled.

Default: 1440 minutes (1 day)
Min: 1 minute

members.name: limitLatestReschedule
members.doc:
Whether there is a limit on the latest reschedule time. When `true`,
a time limit is enforced.

Default: `false`

description: The policy for rescheduling a booked session.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Resource ID.

members.name: description
members.doc: Resource description.

members.name: email
members.doc: Resource email address.

members.name: images
members.doc: Resource images.

members.name: name
members.doc: Resource name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Resource phone number.

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc: List of IDs of schedules owned by this resource.

members.name: schedules
members.doc: Deprecated. Please use scheduleIds. List of the schedules owned by this resource. Min size 1.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Resource status.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"CREATED"` Default status.
- `"DELETED"` The resource was deleted.
- `"UPDATED"` The resource was updated.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: tag
members.doc: Deprecated. Please use tags.

members.name: tags
members.doc: Resource tags. Tags are used to identify, group, and filter the different types of resources. For example, 'staff' or 'room'.

members.name: wixUserId
members.doc:
Wix user ID, if the resource is associated with the Wix user.
A staff member resource can be associated with a Wix user via assignment of a permissions role in the business manager.
<!--ONLY:VELO
Click the **Set Permissions** button for the staff member on the Staff page on your site's dashboard.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: event
members.doc: Event type.

members.name: resource
members.doc:
Updated resource entity.
'resource.schedules' is deprecated and will not be returned. Please use 'resource.scheduleIds' instead.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Schedule ID, used to manage the service's sessions.

members.name: availabilityConstraints
members.doc: Limitations dictating the way session availability is calculated. For appointments only.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: migrationEvent
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: multipleSessionsCreated
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about changed sessions. deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: scheduleUnassignedFromUser
members.doc: Inspect `schedule.scheduleOwnerUserId` on `scheduleUpdated` instead.

members.name: siteProperties
members.doc: site properties. Optional. Given in create schedule notification.

members.name: migrationEvent
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: multipleSessionsCreated
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: scheduleUnassignedFromUser
members.doc: Inspect `schedule.scheduleOwnerUserId` on `scheduleUpdated` instead.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: The schedule that was unassigned from the user.

members.name: userId
members.doc: The Wix user id.

description: Schedule unassigned from user.

members.name: newSchedule
members.doc: The new schedule after the update.

members.name: oldSchedule
members.doc: The old schedule before the update.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: recurringSessions
members.doc:
Recurring sessions updated event. If this field is given, the reason for the schedule updated event was
updating at least one of the given schedule's recurring sessions.
This event is triggered by create/update/delete recurring session apis.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether this notification was created as a result of an anonymization request, such as GDPR.
An anonymized participant will have the following details:
name = "deleted"
phone = "deleted"
email = "deleted@deleted.com"

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tag information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the service was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Service ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the service was updated.

members.name: bookingPolicy
members.doc: Policy determining under what conditions this service can be booked. For example, whether the service can only be booked up to 30 minutes before it begins.

members.name: category
members.doc: The category the service is associated with.

members.name: conferencing
members.doc: Conferencing options for this service.

members.name: defaultCapacity
members.doc: Default maximum number of customers that can book the service. The service cannot be booked beyond this capacity.

members.name: description
members.doc: Service description, such as `High-class hair styling, cuts, straightening and color.`

members.name: form
members.doc: The form used when booking the service.

members.name: hidden
members.doc: Whether the service is hidden from the site.

members.name: locations
members.doc:
The locations this service is offered at.
Only multiple locations of type `BUSINESS` are supported. multiple locations of type `CUSTOM` or `CUSTOMER` are not supported.
For courses only: Currently, only 1 location is supported, for all location types.
Use `setServiceLocations` method to change the locations this service is offered at.

members.name: mainSlug
members.doc:
The main slug for the service. `mainSlug` is either taken from the current service name or is a custom slug set by the business owner.
`mainSlug` is used to construct the service's URLs.

members.name: media
members.doc: Media associated with the service.

members.name: name
members.doc: Service name.

members.name: onlineBooking
members.doc: Online booking settings.

members.name: payment
members.doc: Payment options for booking the service.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the service is updated. To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a service.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: The service's schedule, which can be used to manage the service's sessions.

members.name: seoData
members.doc: Custom SEO data for the service.

members.name: sortOrder
members.doc: Order of a service within a category.

members.name: staffMembersIds
members.doc: IDs of the staff members providing the service. For appointments only.

members.name: supportedSlugs
members.doc:
A slug is the last part of the URL address that serves as a unique identifier of the service.
The list of supported slugs includes past service names for backwards compatibility, and a custom slug if one was set by the business owner.

members.name: tagLine
members.doc: Short service description, such as `Hair styling.`

members.name: type
members.doc: Service type.

members.name: urls
members.doc: URLs to various service-related pages, such as the calendar page and the booking page.

description: The `Service` object represents the business offering that a business provides to its customers.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Session ID.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc:
An object specifying a list of schedules and the way each schedule's availability is affected by the session. For example, the schedule of an instructor is affected by sessions of the class that they instruct.
The array is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden even if the session is a recurring session.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc:
A conference created for the session according to the details set in the schedule's conference provider information.
If the session is a recurring session, this field is inherited from the schedule.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the session. Defaults to the schedule capacity.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: end
members.doc:
An object specifying the end date and time of the session. The `end` time must be after the `start` time and be same type as `start`.
If the session is a recurring session, `end` must contain a `localDateTime`.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc:
A list of properties for which values were inherited from the schedule.
This does not include participants that were inherited from the schedule.

members.name: instanceOfRecurrence
members.doc:
A string representing a recurrence rule (RRULE) if the session is an instance of a recurrence pattern.
Empty when the session is not an instance of a recurrence rule, or if the session defines a recurrence pattern, and `recurrence` is not empty.

members.name: location
members.doc:
An object describing the location where the session takes place.
Defaults to the schedule location.
For single sessions, `session.location.businessLocation` can only be provided for locations that are defined in the schedule using `schedule.location` or `schedule.availability.locations`.

members.name: notes
members.doc:
Additional information about the session.
Notes are not supported for recurring sessions.

members.name: originalStart
members.doc: Original start date and time of the session in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Coordinated_Universal_Time_(UTC)) format.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
List of participants booked for the session.
The list includes participants who have registered for this specific session, and participants who have registered for a schedule that includes this session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: rate
members.doc:
The price options offered for the session.  Defaults to the schedule rate.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: recurrence
members.doc:
A string representing a recurrence rule (RRULE) for a recurring session, as defined in [iCalendar RFC 5545](https://icalendar.org/iCalendar-RFC-5545/3-3-10-recurrence-rule.html).
If the session is an instance of a recurrence pattern, the `instanceOfRecurrence` property will be contain the recurrence rule and this property will be empty.
The RRULE defines a rule for repeating a session.
Supported parameters are:

|Keyword|Description|Supported values|
|--|--|---|
|`FREQ`|The frequency at which the session is recurs. Required.|`WEEKLY`|
|`INTERVAL`|How often, in terms of `FREQ`, the session recurs. Default is 1. Optional.|
|`UNTIL`|The UTC end date and time of the recurrence. Optional.|
|`BYDAY`|Day of the week when the event should recur. Required.|One of: `MO`, `TU`, `WE`, `TH`, `FR`, `SA`, `SU`|


For example, a session that repeats every second week on a Monday until January 7, 2022 at 8 AM:
`"FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20220107T080000Z"`

<!--ORIGINAL COMMENTS:
`FREQ` — The frequency with which the session should be repeated (such as DAILY or WEEKLY).
Supported `WEEKLY` value is supported.
INTERVAL — Works together with FREQ to specify how often the session should be repeated. For example, FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2 means once every two weeks. Optional. Default value is 1.
COUNT — The number of times this event should be repeated. Not yet supported.
UNTIL — The UTC date & time until which the session should be repeated. This parameter is optional. When it is not specified, the event repeats forever.
The format is a short ISO date, followed by 'T' and a short time with seconds and without milliseconds, terminated by the UTC designator 'Z'. For example, until Jan. 19th 2018 at 7:00 AM: 'UNTIL=20180119T070000Z'.
BYDAY - The days of the week when the event should be repeated. Currently, only a single day is supported. This parameter is mandatory.
Possible values are: MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA, SU
Note that DTSTART and DTEND lines are not allowed in this field; session start and end times are specified in the start and end fields.
**Example**: FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20200427T070000Z
ORIGINAL COMMENTS-->

members.name: recurringIntervalId
members.doc:
Recurring interval ID. Defined when a session will be a recurring session. read-only. Optional.
For exmaple, when creating a class service  with recurring sessions, you add a recurrence rule to create recurring sessions.
This field is omitted for single sessions or instances of recurring sessions.
Specified when the session was originally generated from a schedule recurring interval.
Deprecated. Use `recurringSessionId`.

members.name: recurringSessionId
members.doc: The ID of the recurring session if this session is an instance of a recurrence. Use this ID to update the recurrence and all of the instances.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: ID of the schedule that the session belongs to.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the resource or service that the session's schedule belongs to.

members.name: start
members.doc: An object specifying the start date and time of the session. If the session is a recurring session, `start` must contain a `localDateTime`.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Session status.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"CONFIRMED"` Default value.
- `"CANCELLED"` The session was deleted.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for the session.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: timeReservedAfter
members.doc:
Time reserved after the session end time, derived from the schedule availability constraints and the time between slots. Read-only.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Session title.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc:
The number of participants booked for the session. Read-only.
Calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Session type.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"EVENT"` Reserved period of time on the schedule. For example, an appointment, class, course, or blocked time. Events are visible in the Dashboard in the Bookings app's [Booking Calendar](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-about-the-wix-bookings-calendar) page.
- `"WORKING_HOURS"` Placeholder for available time on a resource’s schedule.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: version
members.doc:
The session version.
Composed by the schedule, session and participants versions.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether this notification was created as a result of an anonymization request, such as GDPR.
An anonymized participant will have the following details:
name = "deleted"
phone = "deleted"
email = "deleted@deleted.com"

members.name: number
members.doc: Incremental version number, which is updated on each change to the session or on changes affecting the session.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: ID of the service to assign the custom slug to.

members.name: slugName
members.doc: The custom name to set as the active slug for the service.

members.name: slug
members.doc: The new slug set as the active slug for the service.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

members.name: removedLocationSessionsAction
members.doc: The action to perform on sessions currently set to a removed location.

members.name: locations
members.doc: The locations you specify replace the existing service locations.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

members.name: removedLocationSessionsAction
members.doc: The action to perform on sessions currently set to a removed location.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: ID of the service.

members.name: service
members.doc: The updated service with the newly set locations.

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled.

Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The global time zone value.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the slug was created. This is a system field.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the slug was generated or customized. If `true`, the slug was customized manually by the business owner. Otherwise, the slug was automatically generated from the service name.

members.name: name
members.doc: The unique part of service's URL that identifies the service's information page. For example, `service-1` in `https:/example.com/services/service-1`.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Additional info about the exception. For example, "We close earlier on New Year's Eve."

members.name: endDate
members.doc: End date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: isClosed
members.doc:
Whether the business is closed (or the service is not available) during the exception.

Default: `true`.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

description: Exception to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

members.name: sameAsDuration
members.doc:
Whether the slot duration is used as the split interval value.
If `same_as_duration` is `true`, the `value_in_minutes` is the sum of the first duration in
`schedule.availabilityConstraints.SlotDurations` field, and `schedule.availabilityConstraints.TimeBetweenSlots` field.

members.name: valueInMinutes
members.doc: Number of minutes between available slots' start times when `same_as_duration` is `false`.

description: The time between available slots' start times. For example, For 5 minute slots, 3:00, 3:05, 3:15 etc. For 1 hour slots, 3:00, 4:00, 5:00 etc.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

description: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
SEO tag type.

Supported values: `title`, `meta`, `script`, `link`.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time the period ends in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

__Note:__ If `openDay` and `closeDay` specify the same day of the week `closeTime` must be later than `openTime`.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time the period starts in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

description: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available.

members.name: bookingPage
members.doc: The URL for the booking entry point. It can be either to the calendar or to the service page.

members.name: calendarPage
members.doc: The URL for the calendar. Can be empty if no calendar exists.

members.name: servicePage
members.doc: The URL for the service page.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the service was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Service ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the service was updated.

members.name: bookingPolicy
members.doc: Policy determining under what conditions this service can be booked. For example, whether the service can only be booked up to 30 minutes before it begins.

members.name: category
members.doc: The category the service is associated with.

members.name: conferencing
members.doc: Conferencing options for this service.

members.name: defaultCapacity
members.doc: Default maximum number of customers that can book the service. The service cannot be booked beyond this capacity.

members.name: description
members.doc: Service description, such as `High-class hair styling, cuts, straightening and color.`

members.name: form
members.doc: The form used when booking the service.

members.name: hidden
members.doc: Whether the service is hidden from the site.

members.name: locations
members.doc:
The locations this service is offered at.
Only multiple locations of type `BUSINESS` are supported. multiple locations of type `CUSTOM` or `CUSTOMER` are not supported.
For courses only: Currently, only 1 location is supported, for all location types.
Use `setServiceLocations` method to change the locations this service is offered at.

members.name: mainSlug
members.doc:
The main slug for the service. `mainSlug` is either taken from the current service name or is a custom slug set by the business owner.
`mainSlug` is used to construct the service's URLs.

members.name: media
members.doc: Media associated with the service.

members.name: name
members.doc: Service name.

members.name: onlineBooking
members.doc: Online booking settings.

members.name: payment
members.doc: Payment options for booking the service.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the service is updated. To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a service.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: The service's schedule, which can be used to manage the service's sessions.

members.name: seoData
members.doc: Custom SEO data for the service.

members.name: sortOrder
members.doc: Order of a service within a category.

members.name: staffMembersIds
members.doc: IDs of the staff members providing the service. For appointments only.

members.name: supportedSlugs
members.doc:
A slug is the last part of the URL address that serves as a unique identifier of the service.
The list of supported slugs includes past service names for backwards compatibility, and a custom slug if one was set by the business owner.

members.name: tagLine
members.doc: Short service description, such as `Hair styling.`

members.name: type
members.doc: Service type.

members.name: urls
members.doc: URLs to various service-related pages, such as the calendar page and the booking page.

members.name: mask
members.doc: Explicit list of fields to update.

members.name: mask
members.doc: Explicit list of fields to update.

members.name: service
members.doc: Service to update. [Partial updates](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/bookings/patch-endpoints-and-field-masks-in-update-requests) are supported.

members.name: service
members.doc: The updated service.

members.name: slotDurations
members.doc:
A list of duration options for slots, in minutes. Minimum value for a duration is 1.
The availability calculation generates slots with these durations, where there is no conflict with existing sessions or other availability constraints.

members.name: slotsSplitInterval
members.doc: An object defining the time between available slots' start times.  For example, a slot with slots_split_interval=5 can start every 5 minutes. The default is the slot duration.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).
Optional. The default is the first duration in slot_durations field.
Deprecated. Use the `split_slots_interval.value_in_minutes`.

members.name: timeBetweenSlots
members.doc:
The number of minutes between the `end` of one slot, and the `start` of the next.
Minimum value is 0, maximum value is 120.

description: Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

members.name: address
members.doc: Free text address used when locationType is `OWNER_CUSTOM`.

members.name: businessLocation
members.doc:
Valid when `locationType` is `OWNER_BUSINESS`. Defaults to the business's location.

`businessSchedule` is not supported by Wix Bookings

members.name: customAddress
members.doc: Custom address, used when locationType is `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`. Might be used when locationType is `"CUSTOM"` in case the owner sets a custom address for the session which is different from the default.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.
One of:
- `"OWNER_BUSINESS"` The business address as set in the site’s general settings.
- `"OWNER_CUSTOM"` The address as set when creating the service.
- `"CUSTOM"` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: message
members.doc: Custom message to send to the participants about the changes to the booking.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc:
Whether to send the message about the changes to the customer.

Default: `false`

members.name: _id
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: availability
members.doc:
An object describing how to calculate the schedule's availability.
An empty object indicates that the schedule is not available for booking.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc: A conference created for the schedule. This is used when a participant is added to a schedule.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the schedule's sessions.
Must be at most `1` for schedule whose availability is affected by another schedule. E.g, appointment schedules of the Wix Bookings app.

members.name: conferenceProvider
members.doc: Conferencing Provider. A schedule with a conferencing provider will use to provider information to create a conference on the provider's system when a session is created on the schedule or on one of its linked schedule's.

members.name: created
members.doc: Schedule creation date.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: Fields which were inherited from the Business Info page under Settings in the Dashboard.

members.name: intervals
members.doc:
Specifies the intervals for the sessions calculation. Optional. e.g. when creating class service you can add
pattern for recurring intervals, these intervals can be returned as schedule's sessions or available slots if
there are no other availability calculation constraints and the capacity is bigger then the current total number of sessions' participants.

members.name: location
members.doc: Default location for the schedule's sessions.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
Participants currently registered to sessions in this schedule.
Participants who are registered in the schedule are automatically registered to any session that is created for the schedule.

members.name: rate
members.doc: Price options offered when booking this schedule's slots. Default is no rate.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the schedule's owner entity. This may be a resource ID or a service ID.

members.name: status
members.doc: Schedule status.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for grouping schedules. These tags are the default tags for the schedule's sessions.
The Wix Bookings app uses the following predefined tags to set schedule type: `"INDIVIDUAL"`, `"GROUP"`, and `"COURSE"`. Once the schedule type is set using these tags, you cannot update it. In addition to the app's tags, you can create and update your own tags.

members.name: title
members.doc: Default title for the schedule's sessions. Maximum length: 6000 characters.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants registered to sessions in this schedule, calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Schedule last update date.

members.name: version
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Category name.

members.name: sortOrder
members.doc: Order of a category within a category list.

members.name: slugName
members.doc: The custom name to validate as a slug for the service.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: ID of the service to validate the slug name for.

members.name: slugName
members.doc: The custom name to validate as a slug for the service.

members.name: errors
members.doc: If the slug is invalid, this field is populated with the reasons why the slug is invalid. Validation errors may include `SLUG_IS_TOO_LONG`, `SLUG_CONTAIN_ILLEGAL_CHARACTERS`, and `SLUG_ALREADY_EXISTS`.

members.name: slugName
members.doc: The requested custom slug name to validate. If valid, the slug name can be set as a slug for the service and is populated with the requested slug. Otherwise, `slugName` is empty.

members.name: valid
members.doc: Whether the requested slug name is valid.

members.name: defaultPrice
members.doc: The default price for the service without any variants. It will also be used as the default price for any new variant.

members.name: deposit
members.doc:
The deposit price required to book the service.

Required when: `rateType` is `VARIED` and `paymentOptions.deposit` is `true`

members.name: maxPrice
members.doc: The maximum price a customer may pay for this service, based on its variants.

members.name: minPrice
members.doc: The minimal price a customer may pay for this service, based on its variants.

members.name: participantsVersion
members.doc: Participants version number, updated each time the schedule participants are updated.

members.name: scheduleVersion
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Number of spots available in the waitlist.

Default: 10 spots
Min: 1 spot

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the session has a waitlist. If `true`, there is a waitlist.

Default: `false`

members.name: reservationTimeInMinutes
members.doc:
Amount of time a participant is given to book, once notified that a spot is available.

Default: 10 minutes
Min: 1 spot

description: The policy for the waitlist.
